message: Fork at fight, leafs to shoot and throw grenade.
Collision detection
The world is a grid
Denial: what can you ignore to improve performance?
In this session: http://2011.jsconf.us/#/proposal/aa273630746598e4dec3edb9fcb4ddcf
Fakery
Parallax scrolling: a way of faking depth in a 2D game.
Hmm. don't know what that bounding box collision detection was called.
Falling in Love: "Pistol slut became intwined with my life. It made me fall in love with programming."
Particles are used in Pistol Slut for fireballs, grenade fragments, mortar shrapnel, muzzle flashes, firework sparks, flames, etc.
Performance
But the world is not a grid. So we have bounding boxes as an additional approach.
This is the game Mary is making: http://pistolslut.com/
Size, Speed, Obscurity constitute the illusion of depth.
IMO, behaviour trees can be used for much more than games. (but you already knew that)
The name arose from the most ridiculous idea for a name that combined sex and violence.
If two objects are in the same grid square they are colliding.

Collision detection for bullets: bounding boxes, but there is a bit extra. We want to know the point of collision to show sparks. Where does the trajectory of the bullets collide with the bounding box?

Grenades: Need to determine deflection at the point of collision of the bounding box. However, grenades have a 2D shape unlike bullets, so we need to find where its bounding box collides with the bounding box. Did she say tweeping?
Brainless Idiots (the code that runs enemies)
Behaviour trees (state machine)
Behaviour trees let you understand and change your AI easily.
Unmoving Objects can gain a perf improvement by pre loading its bounding box, and replying to requests when it is on camera.
States: fighting, shooting
If you are in a fork point of a behaviour tree you are deciding what to do next, if you at a leaf, you are doing something like shooting a bullet.
Movement around the behaviour tree: Can I? Should I?
Strategy: sequentialization: applies all the leaf and moves back to the branch.
Behaviour trees are represented in JSON.
Strategy: prioritised: do a leaf, and move back to the top of the tree.
FYI: I'm spelling behaviour the British way b/c that's how her slides spell it :)
Sylvester for vector math: http://sylvester.jcoglan.com/
Here are Mary's slides: http://maryrosecook.com/post/pistol-slut-talk-slides
